alfredsnippet.snippet:
Halton Arp, Seeing Red, p.258

"I had only one year of formal schooling up to the seventh grade when I discovered a wrong answer in the back of the book. I was amazed at the reaction of the teacher and the class who could not believe the answer in the book was not correct. Right from the beginning in science, authority tends to override independent judgement."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Arp's Discovery of a Wrong Answer
